title: Australia for UNHCR
subtitle:
“The tent is falling apart. It leaks...and there is mud beneath us.”

Lamia and her family arrived in Lebanon with no coats or heaters. A survival pack from UNHCR will help her family weatherproof their tent.

Make a difference for Syrian refugees  http://www.unrefugees.org.au/wintersurvival pic.twitter.com/a279b20g1A

title: Ruth McNair AM
subtitle: #QueerDisplacements  At first conference in Australia about LGBTIQ refugees and people seeking asylum.   Loved reference to Hannah Arendt -lack of nationality should not erase humanity or the right to speak and be heard pic.twitter.com/jlvaTLOR5S

title: Australia for UNHCR
subtitle:
How do you explain what a refugee is to a child? It can be as easy as a bedtime story.

"The Unexpected Friend" is a children's book, the first to shed light on the displaced #Rohingya children in Cox’s Bazaar. #WithRefugees http://ow.ly/DYvy50xaqOu pic.twitter.com/IZ9qP2pbxr

subtitle:

title: Clunes Booktown
subtitle:
Ballarat is Victoria’s fastest growing regional city and a designated Refugee Welcome Zone. Presented by The Wheeler Centre, in partnership with Ballarat Mechanics Institute, a discussion about a global issue at a local level.
⁠Tickets on sale through The Wheeler Centre. pic.twitter.com/oNz5or50YY

title: Tania Mushtaq
subtitle: A fabulous night at Settlement Services International (SSI) Mosaic gala dinner with our @DellTech and @WattersonPR fam. title: NAPHLtd
subtitle: It's International Day for Tolerance, promoting respect, dialogue, cooperation & tolerance of all cultures. On this day we're celebrating NAPHL's Refugee Health Nurses & the important work they do for people who have arrived in Nth Qld under the Aust Gvt's Humanitarian Program. pic.twitter.com/lndazrGdOy

title: The Pantograph Punch
subtitle: "I am a stateless Kurdish-Iranian refugee. Land is what is most precious for Kurdish people and that is what has been taken away from me". Portrait of Emad, a Manus Island refugee who chose sand as his symbolic object, by Hoda Afshar, 2018. On display at Gus Fisher Gallery. pic.twitter.com/ITjgyLuPcM

title: Tina things
subtitle:
And now Dr. Anna hood interviewing @BehrouzBoochani  and @golrizghahraman with astounding knowledge of how NZ & Aus differ in their refugee quota (were less per capita!) and the “great Hope” that was NZ for those in Manus.
“Sometimes (felt) close sometimes so far away” pic.twitter.com/5dBTBjvFrS

title: Claire Farrugia
subtitle: “She looks at the paper, looks at me, looks at the paper, looks at me” Trans people almost immediately fall into a system of statelessness when seeking asylum. Migration/refugee studies needs to account for trans experiences @Obsqueer #QueerDisplacementspic.twitter.com/Pa7u8i8MVP

title: Aydan Greatrick
subtitle:

title: Dr. Carly Copolov
subtitle: Our first talk by Dr Adelman - @FulbrightPrgrm Scholar on cross-cultural communication at Blacktown hospital was a huge success!
